newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: EU says "gravely concerned" at Serbia situation.
newsitem.headline: EU says "gravely concerned" at Serbia situation.

text.p: The European Union said on Monday it was "gravely concerned" about recent developments in Serbia and urged the Serbian authorities to respect the democratic rights of the country's citizens.
Serbia has been shaken by two weeks of street protests in Belgrade after the government annulled an opposition victory in local polls on November 17.
The demonstrators have demanded an end to Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic's nine-year rule. Milosevic has threatened to use force to quell the protests.
"The EU is gravely concerned at current developments in Serbia following the local elections," EU president Ireland said in a statement issued on behalf of the 15-nation bloc.
The EU urged "the full observance of international democratic norms" in Serbia.
"It recalls that these include the rights of peaceful assembly and free speech and calls on the authorities in Belgrade to exercise restraint and to ensure they are fully respected," it said.

The EU said compliance with democratic norms was a "key factor" in the development of its relationship with the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia. It said it would continue to watch the situation closely.
